item.title: Ethics and the Movement of Money: Realist Approaches
item.description: Strange, Susan. “Ethics and the Movement of Money: Realist Approaches.” In Free Movement. Ethical Issues in Transnational Migration of People and Money, edited by Brian Barry, Robert E. Goodin, 232-247. Hemel Hempstead: Harvester Wheatsheaf, 1992. Identifying herself as a Realist, Strange notes that there is not one easily defined Realist perspective on the ethics of international monetary flows. Focusing on the continued existence and relative power of states she explores the problems these flows cause for states and stability in the international system overall.
